#df_combined = df_economy.join(df_lang, on=["kunta", "vuosi"], how="left")
from pyspark.sql import functions as F

# Perform a cross join between the two DataFrames
df_economy.alias("a").crossJoin(df_lang.alias("b")) \
    .filter(
        (F.col("a.kunta") != F.col("b.kunta")) & 
        (F.levenshtein(F.col("a.kunta"), F.col("b.kunta")) <= 2)
    ) \
    .select(F.col("a.kunta"), F.col("b.kunta")) \
    .show()

from pyspark.sql import functions as F

# Set a threshold for similarity (Levenshtein distance)
threshold = 1

# Perform a cross join and filter based on the Levenshtein distance
df_economy.alias("a").crossJoin(df_lang.alias("b")) \
    .filter(
        (F.col("a.kunta") != F.col("b.kunta")) &  # Ensure they're not exactly the same
        (F.levenshtein(F.col("a.kunta"), F.col("b.kunta")) <= threshold)  # Similar based on Levenshtein distance
    ) \
    .select(F.col("a.kunta").alias("kunta_a"), F.col("b.kunta").alias("kunta_b")) \
    .show(400)

df_combined = df_economy.join(df_lang, on=["kunta", "vuosi"], how="left")
df_all_combined=df_combined.join(df_population, on=["kunta", "vuosi"], how="left")
display(df_all_combined)
#for column in df_all_combined.columns:
    #print(column)

df_all_combined.isNull().sum()
